roleset.name: cause an increase (in interest, etc), etc.)
roleset.note: STIMULATE-V NOTES: Based on financial subcorpus. Comparison to 'spark'. Member of Vncls amuse-31.1, force-59-1. (from stimulate.01-v)

example.name: passive
example.text: [Teikoku Oil]-1, also stimulated *trace*-1 by rumors of speculative buying, advanced 100 yen to 1,460.

example.name: active
example.text: Unless the Federal Reserve eases interest rates soon *trace* to stimulate the economy, profits could remain disappointing.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Most recently , the Bank Group has been expanded to include the Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency to stimulate direct foreign investment in developing countries by offering guarantees against noncommercial risk and advice to member countries on how to improve their business climate .
example.arg: direct foreign investment in developing countries
by offering guarantees against noncommercial risk and advice to member countries on how to improve their business climate

example.name: as induce, active
example.text: The very firmness of her convictions and logical clearness of her arguments captivated and stimulated him-2 [*-2] to make greater efforts ...
example.arg: The very firmness of her convictions and logical clearness of her arguments

example.name: as induce, passive
example.text: Without the decay of a sense of objective reference ( except as the imitation of mystery ) , [the stress on subjective invention]-1 would never have been stimulated [*-1]into being .
example.arg: Without the decay of a sense of objective reference ( except as the imitation of mystery )
